channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 smartphone rules parents should follow, according to a social psychologist who has studied the Gen Z mental health crisis
item.description: No smartphones before high school is No. 1.

item.title: Here's what's next for bitcoin after the cryptocurrency returned to $60,000 this week
item.description: Bitcoin is testing a key level once again after the cryptocurrency fell below $60,000 this week for the first time since May 3.

item.title: All three major U.S. stock indexes finish higher, led by Nasdaq Composite
Forget carbon taxes on cars—Denmark is charging farmers a $100 ‘burp tax’ per cow
item.description: The announcement comes after a major biodiversity restoration bill in the European Union was shelved amid protests by farmers all over the continent.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses rising competition at shareholder meeting after stock surge
item.description: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.

item.title: Nvidia controls the AI universe now — but these tech giants could be next
Paris Hilton says Gen Z loves flip phones ‘because they love things that are iconic’
Amazon reaches $2 trillion market cap for the first time
item.description: The company joins other tech heavyweights, such as Nvidia, Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, all of which have crossed a $2 trillion market capitalization.

item.title: Most retail investors are holding on to their cash these days. Here’s why.
The Supreme Court rules in Biden’s favor, tossing out GOP claims that Democrats coerced social media companies to stamp out conservative points of view
item.description: The case is among several before the court this term that affect social media companies in the context of free speech.

item.title: Google is testing facial recognition technology for campus security, starting at site near Seattle
item.description: According to internal documents, Google is testing facial recognition technology at a site in Kirkland, Washington.

item.title: Target and Walmart are seeking to beat Amazon to the ‘Prime Day’ punch
Carnival shares rise as flood of demand for cruise bookings bolsters record quarterly results
item.description: The momentum is driven by record booking volumes for 2025 sailings, the cruise company announced on Tuesday.

item.title: Interactive Brokers reveals $48 million loss from NYSE glitch
item.description: The brokerage had filed claims with the NYSE to compensate it for these losses, but the exchange denied its ask, Interactive said.

item.title: Chipotle dips as 50-for-1 stock split takes effect. No surprise, says history.
